Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg
The representatives gave their answer in the World Government's emergency meeting, approving Karenina's decision and giving her the right to destroy the zero-point engine.
Still, it will inevitably cause a series of problems... The lunar base, the reactor, the ground battlefield, Kurono...

The biggest problem is that the comms to the lunar base are still not restored. Babylonia is unable to confirm whether Karenina and her team have successfully destroyed the engine, or whether they can safely return.
What if Karenina and her team are injured... Or cannot finish the mission at all...
Bianca
Commander Nikola! Please, let me go. I can help the lunar base... and Karenina.

Nikola has actually thought about this option. When it comes to searching for lost targets in an unfamiliar environment, nobody can do the job better than the Purifying Force—although they are hunting the target most of the time.
Nikola
No... This is the second time I'm saying this.
Nikola shakes his head and gives back Bianca's application.
Nikola
As the captain of the Purifying Force, as a soldier, you should know your duty is to obey orders.
The other female Construct in the room also walks up and salutes Nikola.
Chiko
Commander Nikola... One Construct is more than enough to investigate the traitors. I can do this. Captain Bianca doesn't need to be involved.
Although respectful, the female Construct named Chiko has not backed down in the slightest. She is also a member of the Purifying Force.
Bianca
Chiko...
Bianca looks at Chiko. She has gone to Earth multiple times for this dangerous mission, but no progress is made.
Although the Engineering Force's new engine has made shuttles more secure, going from Babylonia to the ground is still a dangerous trip.

Even after a successful landing, the supplies from the Support Force are nowhere enough for combat consumption in the adverse environment. Chiko couldn't even maintain her frame properly; the color of her black long hair had faded, but she simply had no time to restore it.
Nikola
There were traces of Ascendants found during the investigation. HQ decided to up the danger level of this mission, and we now have two locations to investigate. That's why I'm sending you both.
Nikola
The mission locations are also reassigned based on their danger levels. Chiko, Bianca will take over City 006 from you. There is a new location named City 015, and I want you to take charge.
Chiko
But...

The mission instructions suggest City 006 has a higher danger potential... So it makes perfect sense to assign it to Bianca, given that she is the captain. Unable to find any excuse, Chiko can only remain silent.
Nikola pauses and looks at Bianca. She seems to have something to say.
Nikola
We are just as worried about Karenina and the lunar base as you are. That's why I have already sent the entire Mountain Vulture squad in a space fighter.
Bianca and Chiko have no words to say. They can only salute in silence.
Bianca
I have only one request. If there is any news about Karenina... Please let me know immediately.
Nikola
Hmph... You don't need to worry about that. Any news about her will be the biggest news.

After the two Purifying Force Constructs left, Nikola once again picks up the mission requests to investigate the traitors. They came from many departments, but only the change of location was provided by the Control Court.
Nikola
I know the Control Court manages a lot of things, but why would they pay particular attention to this one out of all missions...
Nikola

Despite suffering heavy damage, Gray Raven still applied to return to the battlefield multiple times. I had to stop them with the Star of Life. But maybe I can send them to the less dangerous City 015 for an investigation mission...
His thoughts are interrupted by an incoming comms request.
Nikola
Speaking...
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab
Celica
It's from the captain of Mountain Vulture, Commander Nikola.
Nikola
Have we found the Engineering Force? What are the coordinates...?
Celica sounds embarrassed as she hesitates a little.
Celica
Um... No. They seem to have encountered an enemy!
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory211.png
A transport shuttle is flying in space. The Moon has become quite small behind it.
Teddy
That monster who merged with the zero-point engine... How did it get on the Moon?
Karenina
I don't know... But it probably wasn't there in the beginning.
Karenina takes out the cassette recorder she found in the zero-point reactor core—she has already learned about its content.
Teddy
Hmm...? This is quite an antique audio player. Never thought you could have this taste—I guess listening to music can more or less help you change your barbarian way of thinking.
Karenina replied with a "tsk" and ignored her. She stares at the starry universe outside.

The root cause of the lunar base incident could be traced to the past. The consequence of the "necessary sacrifice" made back then is still posting a threat to all humans today, and it may well last into the future.
Fortunately, humans may finally have enough power to change that future...
Karenina
So how did you find this spaceship...? I don't recall seeing any record of spacecraft staying in the lunar base.
Teddy
No idea. This is quite an old ship. Probably served in the Post-Pandemic Age... It was made in Kurono, but is currently registered under Babylonia.
Karenina
Could it be that the spaceship picking us up had departed earlier? We are pretty lucky.
RImgBg1Shake
RImgBg1Shake
Yarha
Excuse me, I hate to interrupt you, but... Karenina, your hand is on my head.
Karenina
Oops... Sorry...
Teddy
Hmph... If we are lucky, we wouldn't have to face this just hours before retreat...
RImgBg1Shake
RImgBg1Shake
Yarha
Um... Sorry again, but you are stepping on my abdomen, Teddy...
Teddy
No wonder it feels soft... Yarha, don't you think you need some exercise?
Yarha
Ahaha... P-please stop it...
Karenina
Aaargh! Why are we all cramped up in such a tiny pod!
The Engineering Force, Kurono scientists, along with some fainted soldiers... Tens of people are squeezed inside the little life pod like a sardine can.
Teddy
Well, we are lucky that we are still alive. We should think about how we can restore that zero-point engine after we go back.
Karenina
Wouldn't that be an easy task with all the information you bring back?
Teddy
It better be... We almost died for it. The entire Engineering Force won't forgive you if you screw it up.
Karenina
Just wait and see... You can start thinking of a name for the new engine.
Haha, how about "DeLorean"? It comes from an old classic movie.
A male voice comes from the ship's internal broadcast. He probably is the pilot.
He saved everyone after all, so Karenina couldn't blame him for the awkward conversation. Besides, he must have also heard her complaints on the limited cabin space.
Karenina
Um... That's actually not bad...
Teddy
Um, excuse me...
Just call me Rolmo... Captain Rolmo. Has a nice ring to it, doesn't it?
Teddy
Captain Rolmo... How long will it take for this ship to arrive at Babylonia?
Rolmo
Well... I'm not so sure. Maybe it will take a day, or 8 hours, or 10 minutes.
His bizarre estimate makes Karenina and Teddy even more confused.
Karenina
Hey, Teddy, why do I find his voice a little familiar...?
A sudden turbulence interrupts Karenina. It does not feel like the ship has hit a meteorite or space debris...
Teddy
Did something happen?
Rolmo
Oops, haha. Don't worry, we are just under attack by Babylonia's space fighters.
Karenina
What?! Why is Babylonia attacking us?
Rolmo
Didn't take long for them to find out that I jacked the ship...
Karenina
What?! Did you jack the ship..? ****! Who the heck are you?!
Karenina searches her memories and finally recalls this annoying voice she heard in the past.
Rolmo
Sigh, you invited yourselves to my ship and still dare to be picky. That's why I don't like humans.
The pilot who calls himself Rolmo lets out a sigh, but soon changes into a cheerful tone.
Rolmo
Alrighty, dear passengers, our trip is coming to an end. I wish you a pleasant and safe journey. Time to say goodbye. Ciao!
After a slight shock, the safety lock of the life pod is disengaged. In Karenina's high-pitch swearing, "Captain Rolmo" ejects the life pod into space, then accelerates toward the Earth.
